question.title: Use Hibernate to verify Java enum matches Postgres enum
question.body:
The same values, in the same order. This isn't hard to put into a unit test

final var queryString = 
  "SELECT unnest(enum_range(CAST(NULL AS %s))) AS v".formatted(dbName);
final var query = session.createNativeQuery(queryString, String.class);
final var dataList = query.getResultList();
Assertions.assertEquals(javaList, dataList);

It's also possible to get the list from the database using the information schema, so it should be available when the Session is being constructed. That means, it should be possible to use an Annotation that will do the same thing, without relying on unit tests. But I have little idea how to do thisâ€¦ Any ideas?

EDIT: So, to explain more thoroughly, I would like an annotation that causes the Session Factory build to error out, as it would if you specified a non-existent column in a @Column(name="fake") annotation or some other mismatch between the annotations and the existing database.
